page.title: 02HARTSWOOD MANOR REIGATE
page.content: At Hartswood Manor Pheasantry which belongs to Charrington's the brewers, there are 1700 pheasants.The gamekeeper hopes to shoot 1000 pheasants this year.The mainly deciduous woodland in this area is good cover for the pheasants because it has tall trees for them to roost in and mainly brambles to hide in. The gamekeeper takes the pheasants' eggs and his chickens hatch them. The gamekeeper had recently seen poachers snooping around using the lamping method to poach.This involves bringing a powerful lamp and shining it in the pheasants' eyes.Because they are blinded by the light they do not move and the poachers steal them. Each pheasant costs Â£5 to prepare for shooting.
